lines.text: You know that I am of royal blood. Everybody knows that Didi comes from a noble line.
You come from a noble line all right... a noble line a sailor gave your foolish mother.
How do you want your eggs? Poached, fried or raw?
Scrambled - like your head.
[Lily spots lipstick on Tom's cheek]
What's this?
I hope it's blood.
If your wife sees it, it will be.
[Tom's daughter demonstrates the hip lingo she's picked up]
Gee, Mom, you look really groovy. Gee, Dad, you look real beat.
What kind of mood was Martha in when she got home?
She was so mad, I couldn't tell.
Well, at least she still loves me enough to hate me.
The whole thing sounds underhanded, disgraceful and messy, and you can count on me.
[Didi is worried about living along in Meade's rustic cabin]
What if something goes wrong?
Well, everything's practically new; except the water pipes hum a little, but they're on key.

[to DiDi]
You're that dame - the biggest thing in bathtubs since rings.

[to DiDi in his bathtub]
Why don't you slip into something less comfortable?
All I ask is that some day they invent a way to make pictures without actors.
Lily, I could almost kiss you. I said 'almost.'

[Trying to lift DiDi out of bathtub]
You take the safe half.
I don't think she has a safe half.
